The burden<S>4853</S> of Moab<S>4124</S>. Because in the night<S>3915</S> Ar<S>6144</S> of Moab<S>4124</S> is laid waste<S>7703</S>, and brought to silence<S>1820</S>; because in the night<S>3915</S> Kir<S>7024</S> of Moab<S>4124</S> is laid waste<S>7703</S>, and brought to silence<S>1820</S>; <sup>brought: or, cut off</sup>
He is gone up<S>5927</S> to Bajith<S>1006</S>, and to Dibon<S>1769</S>, the high places<S>1116</S>, to weep<S>1065</S>: Moab<S>4124</S> shall howl<S>3213</S> over Nebo<S>5015</S>, and over Medeba<S>4311</S>: on all their heads<S>7218</S> shall be baldness<S>7144</S>, and every beard<S>2206</S> cut off<S>1438</S>.
In their streets<S>2351</S> they shall gird<S>2296</S> themselves with sackcloth<S>8242</S>: on the tops<S>1406</S> of their houses, and in their streets<S>7339</S>, every one shall howl<S>3213</S>, weeping<S>1065</S> abundantly<S>3381</S>. <sup>weeping: Heb. descending into weeping, or, coming down with weeping</sup>
And Heshbon<S>2809</S> shall cry<S>2199</S>, and Elealeh<S>500</S>: their voice<S>6963</S> shall be heard<S>8085</S> even unto Jahaz<S>3096</S>: therefore the armed soldiers<S>2502</S> of Moab<S>4124</S> shall cry out<S>7321</S>; his life<S>5315</S> shall be grievous<S>3415</S> unto him.
My heart<S>3820</S> shall cry out<S>2199</S> for Moab<S>4124</S>; his fugitives<S>1280</S> shall flee unto Zoar<S>6820</S>, an heifer<S>5697</S> of three years old<S>7992</S>: for by the mounting up<S>4608</S> of Luhith<S>3872</S> with weeping<S>1065</S> shall they go it up<S>5927</S>; for in the way<S>1870</S> of Horonaim<S>2773</S> they shall raise up<S>5782</S> a cry<S>2201</S> of destruction<S>7667</S>. <sup>his: or, to the borders thereof, even to Zoar, as an heifer</sup> <sup>destruction: Heb. breaking</sup>
For the waters<S>4325</S> of Nimrim<S>5249</S> shall be desolate<S>4923</S>: for the hay<S>2682</S> is withered away<S>3001</S>, the grass<S>1877</S> faileth<S>3615</S>, there is no green thing<S>3418</S>. <sup>desolate: Heb. desolations</sup>
Therefore the abundance<S>3502</S> they have gotten<S>6213</S>, and that which they have laid up<S>6486</S>, shall they carry away<S>5375</S> to the brook<S>5158</S> of the willows<S>6155</S>. <sup>brook: or, valley of the Arabians</sup>
For the cry<S>2201</S> is gone round about<S>5362</S> the borders<S>1366</S> of Moab<S>4124</S>; the howling<S>3215</S> thereof unto Eglaim<S>97</S>, and the howling<S>3215</S> thereof unto Beerelim<S>879</S>.
For the waters<S>4325</S> of Dimon<S>1775</S> shall be full<S>4390</S> of blood<S>1818</S>: for I will bring<S>7896</S> more<S>3254</S> upon Dimon<S>1775</S>, lions<S>738</S> upon him that escapeth<S>6413</S> of Moab<S>4124</S>, and upon the remnant<S>7611</S> of the land<S>127</S>. <sup>more: Heb. additions</sup>
